column4: Can anyone help me set my 'default gateway device' so that I don't have to manually set it every time I boot?
it didn't ask you during the install?
I don't know about the gui tools, the correct fix would be adding a gateway line in /etc/network/interfaces
I think we're not talking about the same thing.  I'm not talking about my default gateway (IP address), I'm talking about the default network interface (in my case wlan0)
whichever interface has the gateway line in /etc/network/interfaces is the default interface
It should be that way, yes, but it's not working that way for me.
I think commenting out the last 3 lines will fix it
actually... someone suggested that would solve my problem!  so, it doesn't work either way.
well, that should bring it up for you, I don't know why it wouldn't work
maybe someone on the user list might know
The interface is brought up (sorta?) but it doesn't work until I set the 'default gateway device' to 'wlan0' in the GUI tool
I don't know what the gui tool does, unfortunately
neither do I ;]   Thanks for giving it a whirl though
I think wlan0 does eventually come up automatically, just takes a long time (1-2min) to kick in.
